data.name: ACR_Caption
data.value: Enter the ACR value if available OR check the box if your lab does not report the ACR value if it is in the normal (<2.0 mg/mmol) range

data.name: CHECK_REQUEST
data.value: I request the cheque(s) to be issued as following:

data.name: CHRC_Responsibility
data.value: The Canadian Heart Research Centre respects its responsibility to uphold the privacy of its collaborators and clients. We store contact information in our secure, internal database. Contact information is never sold or shared with external parties and only utilized for the purposes of making stakeholders aware of future initiatives and events. You will always have the option to unsubscribe.

data.name: CLICK_HERETO_VIEW
data.value: To view/print this document, please click here.

data.name: CLICK_SUBMIT
data.value: Click the "Submit" button once you have completed the Payee Form

data.name: COMPLETE_REGISTARTION_P1
data.value: By participating in the VISTA DM Program you are eligible to become a Canadian Heart Research Centre physician member. Due to your contribution to quality enhancement and professional development activities with our organization, the annual membership fee of $125.00 will be waived. Please check the box below if you wish to take advantage of this opportunity. Upon your acceptance, our Membership Coordinator will forward the full membership benefits package.

data.name: COMPLETE_REGISTARTION_P2
data.value: I accept the opportunity and agree to join the Canadian Heart Research Centre as a physician member

data.name: DISTOLIC_SYSTOLIC
data.value: Diastolic cannot be greater than Systolic

data.name: DONT_HAVE_REG
data.value: If you don’t have a unique registration ID, click here

data.name: EMAIL_VISTA
data.value: Please email us at info@vistadm.ca to obtain your Unique Registration ID

data.name: FUTUREEMAIL_1
data.value: Would you like to receive email correspondence (opt-in) from the Canadian Heart Research Centre for future initiatives and events?

data.name: FUTUREEMAIL_3
data.value: The Canadian Heart Research Centre respects its responsibility to uphold the privacy of its collaborators and clients. We store contact information in our secure, internal database. Contact information is never sold or shared with external parties and only utilized for the purposes of making stakeholders aware of future initiatives and events. You will always have the option to unsubscribe.

data.name: INCLUDE_NAME
data.value: Please include your First Name, Last Name City and Province

data.name: MOU10
data.value: Complete the electronic Practice Assessment Forms (e-PAFs) for Phase I and Phase II and feedback forms on patients that meet the program eligibility criteria in adherence with the program timelines;

data.name: MOU11
data.value: Provide a copy of your medical license and a current Curriculum Vitae if requested by the CHRC;

data.name: MOU12
data.value: Be available to answer any data queries;

data.name: MOU13
data.value: Exercise reasonable and diligent efforts and professional expertise in the conduct and completion of the program documents in an efficient and timely manner and in compliance with the program instructions.

data.name: MOU24
data.value: Participating physician will have the following responsibilities with respect to Confidential Information:

data.name: MOU25
data.value: Confidential Information: defined as confidential or proprietary information of the CHRC and/or the Sponsor either disclosed orally or in writing to or otherwise learned by the participating physician through participation in the VISTA DM program that should reasonably be known to be confidential or proprietary to the CHRC and/or the Sponsor, including but not limited to: research, development and clinical programs, data and results, educational products, inventions, works of authorship, trade secrets, processes, conceptions, formulas, patents, patent applications, and licenses, business, product, marketing, sales, scientific and technical strategies, programs and results, including costs and prices, suppliers, manufacturers, customers, market data, personnel, and consultants and other confidential matters related to the CHRC and/or the Sponsor.

data.name: MOU27
data.value: Shall not use Confidential Information except for the purpose of evaluating, negotiating and/or participating in the VISTA DM program

data.name: MOU28
data.value: Will hold Confidential Information in strictest confidence and shall not disclose Confidential Information to others, except for its employees or agents who require Confidential Information for the purpose of evaluating or negotiating the business relationship in relation to the VISTA DM program and who are subject to binding obligations of confidentiality and restricted use, participating physician shall be solely responsible for compliance with the terms of Confidential Information by such employees or agents;

data.name: MOU29
data.value: Will protect the confidentiality of Confidential Information using at least the same level of efforts and measures used to protect its own confidential information, and at least commercially reasonable efforts and measures, including without limitation limiting access to Confidential Information commensurate with the purposes of this MOU and keeping adequate records of those with access to Confidential Information and of all uses or dispositions of Confidential Information;

data.name: MOU30
data.value: Will notify the CHRC as promptly as practicable of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information

data.name: MOU31
data.value: Acknowledges and agrees that there are no known circumstances which would place the participating physician in a conflict of interest as a result of the performance of the VISTA DM program.

data.name: MOU32
data.value: The CHRC will have the following responsibilities

data.name: MOU33
data.value: Provide all the necessary program materials to the participating physician;

data.name: MOU34
data.value: Be available to answer questions in relation to the VISTA DM program documents, instructions and/or the completion of the practice assessment forms / practice re-assessment forms

data.name: MOU35
data.value: Provide physicians with remuneration for properly completed program components as following:

data.name: MOU36
data.value: Needs Assessment: $100.00 for the completion of the needs assessment survey

data.name: MOU37
data.value: Phase I: Practice Assessment: $50.00 per electronic practice assessment form (up to $500.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic practice assessment forms)

data.name: MOU38
data.value: Phase I: Practice Re-Assessment: $25.00 per electronic measure assessment form (up to $250.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic measure assessment forms)

data.name: MOU39
data.value: Phase II: Practice Assessment: $75.00 per electronic practice assessment form (up to $750.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic practice assessment forms)

data.name: MOU40
data.value: Phase II: Practice Re-Assessment A: $30.00 per electronic per electronic measure assessment form (up to $300.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic measure assessment forms)

data.name: MOU41
data.value: Phase II: Practice Re-Assessment B: $30.00 per electronic per electronic measure assessment form (up to $300.00 for the completion of ten (10) interactive electronic measure assessment forms)

data.name: MOU42
data.value: Program Evaluation: $100.00 for the completion of the program evaluation

data.name: MOU43
data.value: Participants who complete all the required program components will be compensated $2,300.00

data.name: MOU45
data.value: By participating in the VISTA DM Program the relationship of the participating physician to the CHRC is that of an independent contractor. Physician shall have no authority to make agreements with third parties that are binding on the CHRC.

data.name: MOU46
data.value: To view/print this document, please click here.

data.name: MOU48
data.value: have read and agree to the terms of the Memorandum of Understanding and certify that I hold a valid license to practice medicine in Canada.

data.name: MOU5
data.value: Thank you for agreeing to participate in the VISTA DM (eVIdence baSed pracTice progrAm in Diabetes Mellitus) initiative. VISTA DM is coordinated by the Canadian Heart Research Centre ("CHRC") and is supported by the Boehringer-Ingelheim and Eli Lilly Alliance ("Sponsor").

data.name: MOU6
data.value: Please review the following information and make yourself familiar with the VISTA DM program components, as well as your expected role as a program participant, and the CHRC's role, as the coordinating centre.

data.name: MOU7
data.value: The participating physician will have the following responsibilities:

data.name: MOU8
data.value: Read and understand this Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) and the VISTA DM materials and timelines and ensure that all person(s) in your practice who may be associated with this initiative also review and understand these materials;

data.name: MOU9
data.value: Partake in the VISTA DM initiative in its entirety or promptly advise the CHRC if you are unable to complete the project;

data.name: MOU_AGREEMENT
data.value:
I have read and agree to the terms of the Memorandum of Understanding
and certify that I hold a valid license to practice medicine in Canada.

data.name: MOU_Instruction_1
data.value: Acknowledging that you have reviewed and agree to the terms of this MOU is a mandatory requirement

data.name: MOU_Instruction_2
data.value: Please review this MOU in its entirety by scrolling to the end of the form

data.name: MOU_Instruction_3
data.value: Once you have reviewed the MOU, check the "Agree to Terms" box and click the "Submit" button

data.name: MOU_Instruction_4
data.value: Once the MOU is completed, the status in your dashboard will change to a checkmark

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_ALL_NONE
data.value: Check ALL that Apply or Select "None of the Above

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_DIABETESHEALTH
data.value: ACCESS TO DIABETES HEALTH CARE TEAM

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_FOOTER1
data.value: If you click the "SUBMIT" button, the responses will be considered final and no modifications can be made.

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_FOOTER2
data.value: If you click the "REVIEW" button, you will be able to review all previous pages of e-PAF and make any applicable modifications if warranted. Once you have reviewed / modified the e-PAF to your satisfaction, you will be able to submit the final version.

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_1
data.value: Please complete the Needs Assessment survey in its entirety. Your survey responses can only be viewed by you and individual survey results will never be shared

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_10
data.value: The CHRC will remunerate you $100.00 for completing the Needs Assessment Survey

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_2
data.value: The survey consists of five (5) pages and should take between 15 – 20 minutes to complete

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_3
data.value: Click the "Save" button, to save the progress of the current page

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_4
data.value: Once you have completed the entire page, click the "Next" button to proceed to the next page of the survey. Clicking the "Next" button will automatically save the entries of the previous page (if entirely completed)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_5
data.value: To return to the previous page of the survey, click the "Back" button. Please note that if you click the “Back” button before completing the page in its entirety, you will lose the progress for the current page.

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_6
data.value: Once you have completed the survey and click "Next" on Page 5, you can either:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_7
data.value: Click the "Review" button to return to Page 1 of the survey to review your entries and/or make changes to your responses

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_8
data.value: Click the "Submit" button once you are satisfied with your responses and consider the survey as final. Once the survey is submitted, you will not be able to make changes to your responses but will be able to return and view your responses.

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_INSTR_9
data.value: Once the Needs Assessment Survey is submitted, the status in your dashboard will change to a checkmark

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_I_DONOTEVALUATE
data.value: Check ALL that apply or Select "I do not evaluate adherence")

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q10
data.value: Select ONE response for each row:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q10_Limited
data.value: Limited availability in my practice location

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q10_Limited2
data.value: Limited availability elsewhere in the community

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q10_NoAvialability
data.value: No availability in my practice location and elsewhere in the community

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q10_ReadilyAvailable
data.value: Readily available in my practice location

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q10_ReadilyElsewhere
data.value: Readily available elsewhere in the community

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q11
data.value: In the community where I practice, partnerships with community organizations focusing on improving diabetes care:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q11_A2
data.value: Are being considered but have not yet been implemented

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q11_A3
data.value: Are formed to develop supportive programs and policies

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q11_A4
data.value: Are actively sought to develop formal supportive programs and policies across the entire system

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q12_A1
data.value: I do not link patients who have diabetes to community resources as consistently as I would like

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q12_A2
data.value: I give my patients who have diabetes the name and phone number of a community resource, and it is up to the patient to make the contact

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q12_A3
data.value: I have allied health staff in my office who act as a community resource to my patients

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q12_A4
data.value: I have a staff member who is responsible for ensuring that the doctors, practice staff, and my patients who have diabetes make maximum use of community resources

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q12_A5
data.value: I have excellent community-wide coordination between my office and community agencies in caring for patients who have diabetes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q13
data.value: In my practice, self-management support for patients who have diabetes:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q13_A2
data.value: Consists only of distribution of information (e.g., pamphlets, booklets)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q13_A3
data.value: Involves referral to self-management classes or educators

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q13_A4
data.value: Is provided by trained personnel in my practice who are designated to do self-management support

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q14_A1
data.value: I do not consistently address self-management concerns with patients who have diabetes and their families

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q14_A2
data.value: I address self-management concerns of specific patients who have diabetes who seem to need it

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q14_A3
data.value: I address self-management issues during each diabetes patient's visit as part of the philosophy of the practice

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q14_A4
data.value: I address self-management issues by routinely referring to well-established programs

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q14_A5
data.value: I systematically assess the self-management needs of patients who have diabetes and use peer support groups routinely

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q15
data.value: In my practice, support for behavior change interventions:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q15_A2
data.value: Is limited to the distribution of pamphlets, booklets, or other written information

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q15_A3
data.value: Is available by referral to others who are skilled in this area

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q15_A4
data.value: Is available from the physicians and staff of my practice, who use proven techniques to effect behavior change

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q16
data.value: In my practice, evidence-based guidelines for diabetes care:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q16_A1
data.value: Are not readily available at the time of patient visits

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q16_A2
data.value: Are available in my practice, but not easy to access rapidly

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q16_A3
data.value: Are available and integrated into my charting system (e.g., flow sheets with embedded guidelines, personal digital assistants [PDAs])

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q16_A4
data.value: Are available, supported by physician education, and integrated into care through reminders and other proven behavior change methods

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17
data.value: My practice follows the following protocol for informing patients about guidelines:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A1
data.value: I do not regularly inform patients about guidelines

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A2
data.value: I give patients guideline handouts if they ask for them

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A3
data.value: I routinely give patients a copy of guidelines or refer them to the appropriate website pertinent to their care

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q17_A4
data.value: I routinely give patients guidelines with personalized targets for them to achieve and with recommendations about how to achieve the targets

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A1
data.value: I have to do almost everything if I want to be sure my patients who have diabetes receive the care they need

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A2
data.value: Although we don't talk about "teams," I do have competent staff to assist me in providing excellent care for my patients who have diabetes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A3
data.value: I have regular staff meetings in which we discuss specific issues to improve care of our patients who have diabetes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q18_A4
data.value: I am part of an interdisciplinary diabetes team and everyone understands their role in caring for patients who have diabetes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A2
data.value: Is scheduled by the patient at the end of each visit

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A3
data.value: Is scheduled by the practice in accordance with guidelines

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A4
data.value: Is scheduled by the practice in accordance with guidelines with routine appointment reminders to the patient

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q19_A5
data.value: Is proactive with patient recall system and routine appointment reminders

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20
data.value: In my practice, planned visits for patients who have diabetes:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A2
data.value: Are used if patients are not doing well or need refills

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A3
data.value: Are used if patients are not doing well. Reminder cards are used, but there is no long-term planning for regular visits

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A4
data.value: Checklists and flow sheets are used, in addition to other tools, to ensure key elements of care are provided

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A5
data.value: Are used for all patients and include regular assessment, preventive interventions, and attention to self-management support

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q20_A6
data.value: Are used systematically to optimize patient follow-up; in addition, missed elements of planned care are easily spotted through an alert system

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21
data.value: In my practice, coordination of care between my office and subspecialists:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21_A2
data.value: Is done reasonably well, but depends mostly on written communication between my office, subspecialists and other relevant providers

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21_A3
data.value: Is done quite well, with adequate oral and written communication between my office, subspecialists, and other relevant providers

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q21_A4
data.value: Is a high priority and includes active coordination between my office, subspecialists, and other relevant groups

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22
data.value: In my practice, a diabetes registry:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22_A2
data.value: Is used to maintain patient information, such as name, diagnosis, contact information, and date of last contact, either on paper or in a computer database

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22_A3
data.value: Is used to identify patients regarding specific clinical information (e.g., data collection for measuring/tracking, identifying patients for planned visits or group visits)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q22_A4
data.value: Is tied to guidelines and provides prompts and reminders about needed services (e.g., lab and other testing), and/or is an integral function of our electronic health record

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23
data.value: Reminders to physicians and other team members:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23_A2
data.value: Include general notifications of the existence of a diagnosis of diabetes, but do not describe needed services at the time of encounter

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23_A3
data.value: Include indications of needed services for populations of patients through periodic reporting

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q23_A4
data.value: Include specific information for the team about guideline adherence at the time of individual patient encounters

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q24
data.value: In my practice, performance feedback regarding diabetes care:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q24_A2
data.value: Is provided at infrequent intervals and/or about a limited number of patients

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q24_A3
data.value: Occurs at frequent enough intervals to monitor performance and is specific to each physician

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q24_A4
data.value: Is timely and specific to each physician, and we routinely review the reports and strive to remedy any deficiencies as rapidly as possible

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q25_A1
data.value: Are not part of the chart in most cases

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q25_A2
data.value: Are noted in each patient's chart

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q25_A3
data.value: Are established collaboratively and include self-management as well as clinical goals

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q25_A4
data.value: Are established collaboratively and include self-management as well as clinical goals. Individual treatment goals and targets are discussed and adjusted frequently, with input from patients

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q26
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes receive diet and exercise plans with measurable goals from you?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q27
data.value: How often do you document discussions about diet and exercise in the patient's chart?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q28
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes are referred by you to a Certified Diabetes Educator or recognized disease-state-management education program?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q29
data.value: How often do you document these referrals in the patient's chart?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q30
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes receive a comprehensive foot exam, including neurologic and vascular testing, at least once every 12 months?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q31
data.value: How often are the results of these foot exams documented in the patient's chart?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q32
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes AT GLYCEMIC TARGET have A1C measurements at least once every 3 months?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q33
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes AT GLYCEMIC TARGET have A1C measurements at least once every 6 months?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q34
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes NOT AT TARGET have A1C measurements at least once every 3 months?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q35
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes NOT AT TARGET have A1C measurements at least once every 6 months?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q36
data.value: Approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes are recommended by you to perform self-monitoring of blood glucose?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q37
data.value: In approximately what percentage of your patients with type 2 diabetes do you inquire about hypoglycemic episodes at every visit?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q38
data.value: How often/when do you discuss specific strategies for hypoglycemia prevention with your patients with type 2 diabetes?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q38_A5
data.value: When patient has a history of hypoglycemic episodes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q39
data.value: How often /when do you take specific action (e.g. modify oral or injectable therapy) when your patients with type 2 diabetes are not meeting their A1C goals?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q39_A5
data.value: Actions based on individual patient needs

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q4
data.value: Population primarily served by your practice:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q40
data.value: How often /when do you take specific action (e.g. modify lifestyle recommendations or pharmacologic therapy) when your patients type 2 diabetes are not at blood pressure or lipid goals?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q40_A5
data.value: Actions based on individual patient needs

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q41
data.value: In your opinion, on average how adherent are your patients with their current medications?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q42
data.value: How do you evaluate adherence in your patients?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q43
data.value: What are your targets for the majority of your patients with type 2 diabetes?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q44
data.value: Of the following, what priority do you give to getting your patients with type 2 diabetes to target?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q45
data.value: In your opinion, what is the MOST COMMON reason for not reaching guideline recommended targets?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q46
data.value: What are the barriers you face in optimizing the management of your high-risk patients?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q46_A2
data.value: Lack of applicability of guidelines to my current practice / patients

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q47
data.value: In your experience, which of the following has been the most significant barrier for patients?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q47_A1
data.value: Patient non-adherence with / inability to achieve lifestyle changes

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q47_A8
data.value: Perceived lack of benefit through media (e.g. statins)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q48
data.value: For patients requiring pharmacological treatment, what influences your choice of therapy?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q48_A4
data.value: What I am most familiar with

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q49
data.value: How comfortable are you with the following medication classes for glycemic control in your patients with diabetes?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q5
data.value: Approximate population size of the community where you practice:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q50
data.value: Which of the following statements best describes how you would approach a newly diagnosed patient with an A1C of ≥9.0%?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q50_A1
data.value: I refer these patients to a diabetes specialist

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q50_A2
data.value: I refer these patients to a diabetes educator

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q50_A3
data.value: I recommend a 2 or 3 month trial of lifestyle (diet, exercise and weight loss)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q50_A5
data.value: I initiate combination therapy (metformin plus another non-insulin agent or metformin plus insulin)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q51
data.value: What is the most common reason for you to refer your patients with type 2 diabetes to a specialist?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q51_A5
data.value: Lack of comfort with newer agents

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q51_A6
data.value: I do not refer patients with diabetes to a specialist

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q52
data.value: What is the 2nd most common reason for you to refer your patients with type 2 diabetes to a specialist?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q52_A5
data.value: Lack of comfort with newer agents

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q6
data.value: On average, how many patients do you see in a week?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q7
data.value: On average, how many patients with diabetes do you see in a week?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q8
data.value: Of those patients you see with diabetes, approximately what percent have type 2 diabetes?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q9
data.value: Do you currently utilize an Electronic Medical Records System in your practice?

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q9_A
data.value: Please specify if you utilize the Electronic Medical Records System for any the following:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q9_A_A5
data.value: Send / receive orders, reports and results

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q9_A_A8
data.value: Generate flow sheets for chronic disease managements (e.g. diabetes flowsheets)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q9_B
data.value: Do you currently have the ability to:

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_Q9_B_A3
data.value: Generate flow sheets for chronic disease managements (e.g. diabetes flowsheets)

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_REVIEW
data.value: You can either Submit or Review / Modify the Survey

data.name: NEEDS_ASSES_SUCCESS
data.value: You have successfully completed the Needs Assessment Survey.

data.name: PAF_INFO
data.value:
FPG ≥7.0 mmol/L
Fasting = no caloric intake for at least 8 hours
or
A1C ≥6.5% (in adults)
Using a standardized, validated assay, in the absence of factors that affect the accuracy of the A1C and not for suspected type 1 diabetes
or
2hPG in a 75-g OGTT ≥11.1 mmol/L
or
Random PG ≥11.1 mmol/L
Random= any time of the day, without regard to the interval since the last meal

2hPG = 2-hour plasma glucose; FPG = fasting plasma glucose; OGTT = oral glucose tolerance test; PG = plasma glucose

Goldenberg, R. et al Definition, Classification and Diagnosis of Diabetes, Prediabetes and Metabolic Syndrome . Can J Diabetes 2013;37(suppl 1): S8 - S11

data.name: PAF_REVIEW
data.value: You can either Submit or Review / Modify the (e-PAF).

data.name: PAF_REVIEW_1
data.value: Please complete the Measure Assessment Form for this patient once the next scheduled visit on

data.name: PAF_REVIEW_SUBMIT
data.value: You have successfully submitted this Practice Assessment Form!

data.name: PAF_REVIEW_VIEW
data.value: You may now view the Feedback Form:

data.name: PAP1_doesMeetEligibility
data.value: This patient does NOT meet any of the Non-Eligibility

data.name: PAP1_EligibilityCriteria
data.value:
Eligibility Criteria: ALL of the criteria must be present
  1. Male and female patients older than 18 years of age
  2. Diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus (CDA definition)
  3. At least ONE prior diabetes related visit
  4. Patient treated with at least ONE antihyperglycemic agent
  5. Next diabetes related visit to occur within the next 3 – 6 weeks

data.name: PAP1_Non_eligibility
data.value: Non-eligibility criteria: None of the criteria present

data.name: PAP1_Non_eligibilitylist
data.value:
1. Clinically significant concomitant kidney (e.g., creatinine clearance < 30 ml / min ) or liver (e.g., active hepatitis) disease
  2. Contraindications or intolerance to combination therapy
  3. Clinically significant concomitant illness or co-morbid condition

data.name: PAP1_satisfiesCriteria
data.value: This patient satisfies all of the Eligibility Criteria

data.name: PCPHOME_10
data.value: VISTA DM is designed as an Evidence Based Practice Program which allows primary care physicians a conscientious, explicit and judicious application of current best evidence (e.g. Clinical Practice Guidelines) in making decisions about the care of individual patients.

data.name: PCPHOME_12
data.value: Integrates best available external clinical evidence from existing systematic research and clinical guideline recommendations……with

data.name: PCPHOME_13
data.value: Practice Based Evidence/ Individual clinical expertise …..while

data.name: PCPHOME_15
data.value: Additionally, this program incorporates knowledge translation through clinical decision making support but the decision to follow the recommendations is left to the participating physician's discretion. VISTA DM has been reviewed and approved by OPTIMUM Clinical Research Inc., an independent, central Ethics Review Board.

data.name: PCPHOME_16
data.value: The online portal has been created to provide you with timely access to the program materials and educational tools as well as provide you with a convenient way to manage the program documents and complete the Electronic Practice Assessment (e-PAFs) and Measure Assessment Forms (e-MAFs). Please keep your username and password confidential.

data.name: PCPHOME_17
data.value: In order to download documents, you will need to enable cookies in your browser. Please follow the link for additional information: Enabling Cookies

data.name: PCPHOME_18
data.value: Please take a few minutes to familiarize yourself with the program requirements and the site functionalities. Download: VISTA DM Program Overview

data.name: PCPHOME_19
data.value: The VISTA DM team is happy to assist you with any questions. Please do not hesitate to contact us at any time: Contact Us

data.name: PCPHOME_2
data.value: Welcome to your Personal VISTA DM Portal

data.name: PCPHOME_20
data.value: We look forward to collaborating with you.

data.name: PCPHOME_24
data.value:
Lawrence A. Leiter, MD
VISTA DM Chair
Division of Endocrinology and Metabolism
St. Michael’s Hospital
Professor of Medicine and Nutritional Sciences
University of Toronto

data.name: PCPHOME_25
data.value:

data.name: PCPHOME_4
data.value: Review and Complete the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)

data.name: PCPHOME_6
data.value: Once you have completed the MOU and the Payee Form, you will gain access to the “VISTA DM Action Items” Section. Please get familiarized with the VISTA DM program components and get started by completing the Needs Assessment survey and identifying eligible patients for Practice Assessment #1

data.name: PCPHOME_9
data.value: On behalf of the Canadian Heart Research Centre and the VISTA DM Planning Committee, we welcome you to your personal online portal and thank you for taking part in this initiative.

data.name: RECEIVE_EMAIL
data.value: Would you like to receive email correspondence (opt-in) from the Canadian Heart Research Centre for future initiatives and events?

data.name: REGISTER2_PLS_REVIEW
data.value: PLEASE REVIEW FOR ACCURACY UPDATE AND COMPLETE BLANK FIELDS WHERE APPLICABLE

data.name: REGISTER2_PLS_WOULD
data.value: Would you like to recieve email correspondence (opt-in) from the Canadian Heart Research Centre for future initiatives and event?

data.name: REGISTER2_PRIVACY_P
data.value: The Canadian Heart Research Centre respects its reponsibility to uphold the privacy of its collaborators and clients. We store contact information in our secure, internal database. Contact information is never sold or shared with external parties and only utilized for the purposes of making stakeholders aware of future initiatives and events. You will always have the option to unsubscribe.

data.name: REGISTEREMAIL_ATTACHMENT
data.value: ~/Email_Templates/Guide to Enabling Cookies in Your Browser.pdf

data.name: REGISTEREMAIL_BEHALF
data.value: On behalf of The CHRC VISTA DM Team

data.name: REGISTER_INCLUDE
data.value: Please include your First Name, Last Name City and Province

data.name: REGISTER_PLSREVIEW
data.value:
PLEASE REVIEW THE INFORMATION BELOW FOR ACCURACY AND
CLICK THE 'CONFIRM' BUTTON TO PROCEED

data.name: REGISTER_PLS_EMAIL
data.value: Please email us at info@vistadm.ca to obtain your Unique Registration ID

data.name: Review_Info
data.value: PLEASE REVIEW THE INFORMATION BELOW FOR ACCURACY AND CLICK THE “CONFIRM” BUTTON TO PROCEED

data.name: SFB_Avoidance
data.value: Avoidance of hypoglycemia especially in the elderly, those with hypoglycemia unawareness, and those with criteria for less stringent control.

data.name: SFB_BMI
data.value: Calculate BMI (mass in kilograms/height in metres<sup>2</sup>)

data.name: SFB_CKD_IDEN
data.value:
Identification of CKD requires screening for proteinuria using random urine ACR (2 out of 3 samples over 3 mths) and assessment of renal function using a serum creatinine converted to eGFR
Type 2 diabetes: Screen at diagnosis and then yearly if no CKD.

data.name: SFB_Dyslipidemia2
data.value:
Fasting lipid levels (TC, HDL, TG and calculated LDL) at diagnosis, then yearly if treatment not initiated. More frequent testing if treatment initiated Statin therapy should be used to reduce cardiovascular risk in adults type 2 diabetes with any of the following features:
  • 1. Clinical macrovascular disease
  • 2. Age >=40 years
  • 3. Age <40 years and 1 of the following
    • diabetes duration>15 years and age >30 years
    • Microvascular complications
    • Warrants therapy based on the presence of other risk factors according to the 2012 Canadian Cardiovascular Society Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Dyslipidemia

data.name: SFB_Dyslipidemia3
data.value: Lipid targets for those who need therapy:Primary target: LDL ≤2.0 mmol/L or ≥50% reduction Alternate Primary target: apo B ≤0.8 g/L or non-HDL-C ≤2.6 mmol/L

data.name: SFB_Enquire_Hypo
data.value: Enquire about hypoglycemia at each visit. Discuss recognition and treatment of hypoglycemia and risk/ benefit of hypoglycemia and pharmacologic management.

data.name: SFB_ENSURE
data.value: Ensure patient can use glucose meter, interpret results and modify treatment as needed. Develop an individualized blood glucose monitoring schedule with patient and review records.

data.name: SFB_Exam2
data.value: Type 2 diabetes: Screen at diagnosis, then annually. Screen for neuropathy with 10-g monofilament or 128 Hz tuning fork at dorsum of great toe. In foot exam look for: structural abnormalities, neuropathy, vascular disease, ulceration, infection

data.name: SFB_Exam3
data.value: Early detection and treatment. If neuropathy present: require foot care education, specialized footwear, smoking cessation. If ulcer present: manage by multidisciplinary team with expertise

data.name: SFB_LastPara
data.value: Adopted from Canadian Diabetes Association’s Sample Diabetes Care Flow Sheet for Adults

data.name: SFB_Measure
data.value: Measure A1C every three months for most adults. Consider testing at least every 6 months in adults during periods of treatment and lifestyle stability when glycemic targets have been consistently achieved

data.name: SFB_Measure2
data.value:
• A1C ≤7.0% for most patients with type 2 diabetes.
  • A1C ≤6.5% may be considered in some patients with type 2 diabetes to further lower the risk of nephropathy and retinopathy which must be balanced against the risk of hypoglycemia.
  • A1C of 7.1 – 8.5% may be considered for patients with type 2 diabetes based on limited life expectancy, functional dependency, extensive coronary artery disease at high risk of ischemia, multiple comorbidities, recurrent severe hypoglycemia, hypoglycemia unawareness, longstanding diabetes unable to achieve A1C ≤7% despite best efforts (including intensified insulin).

data.name: SFB_MeasureBP
data.value: Measure BP at diagnosis and at every diabetes clinic visit

data.name: SFB_NutritionEncourage
data.value: Encourage nutritional therapy (by a registered dietitian) as an integral part of treatment and self-management.

data.name: SFB_NutritionTarget
data.value: Meet nutritional needs by following Eating Well with Canada’s Food Guide

data.name: SFB_PARA
data.value: Adopted from Canadian Diabetes Association’s Sample Diabetes Care Flow Sheet for Adults

data.name: SFB_PA_DISCUSS
data.value: Discuss and encourage aerobic and resistance exercise. Evaluate those with possible CAD or microvascular complications undertaking exercise substantially more vigorous than brisk walking.

data.name: SFB_Premeal
data.value:
Premeal (mmol/L) = 4.0-7.0 mmol/L for most patients
2hr Postmeal (mmol/L) = 5.0-10.0 mmol/L for most patients
5.0-8.0 mmol/L if not achieving A1C target

data.name: SFB_Retinopathy2
data.value: Type 2 diabetes: Screen at diagnosis and 1-2 years after initial screening if no retinopathy is present. The interval for follow-up assessment should be tailored to the severity of the retinopathy. Screening should be conducted by an experienced eye care professional

data.name: SFB_Smoking_Encourage
data.value: Encourage patient to stop at each visit; provide support as needed

data.name: SFB_WaistMeasure
data.value: Measure as an indicator of abdominal fat

data.name: SFB_WaistMeasure2
data.value:
MEN:
Caucasian, African: ≥94 cm
Asian, South or Central American: ≥90 cm
WOMEN:
All women: ≥80 cm

data.name: UPDATE_COMPLETE
data.value: UPDATE AND COMPLETE BLANK FIELDS WHERE APPLICABLE

data.name: WaitlistCall
data.value: Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@vistadm.ca

data.name: WaitlistCaption
data.value:
Thank you for your interest in the VISTA DM Program. 
The registration for this program is now closed.  Please enter your Unique Registration ID below and click the “Waitlist” button to be placed on the waitlist.

data.name: WaitlistHeader
data.value:
PLEASE COMPLETE THE FORM BELOW AND CLICK
THE "JOIN THE WAITLIST" BUTTON

data.name: WaitlistSuccessful
data.value: You have successfully joined the VISTA DM waitlist. A member of our team will be in touch should the registration become available.
